decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, then use reanimation spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead to bring them back into play for a quick win. Thoughtseize, Force of Will, and Daze provide disruption and protection, while Ponder, Brainstorm, and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student help with card selection and manipulation. The deck also includes some versatile threats like Brazen Borrower and Murktide Regent, along with some utility in Orcish Bowmasters and Undercity Sewers. Wasteland helps disrupt opposing lands, while Underground Sea provides the necessary mana fixing.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and aggressively combo off by milling through your entire library and then winning the game with Thassa's Oracle. The deck uses a combination of efficient mana acceleration, graveyard recursion, and disruptive spells to achieve this goal. By playing a compact and focused list of all-in combo pieces, the deck aims to win the game before the opponent has a chance to disrupt its game plan. Timing, sequencing, and careful calculation of resources are crucial to ensure a successful combo finish.

The main concept of this deck is to establish early control over the game by utilizing powerful disruptive elements like Magus of the Moon and Chalice of the Void to hinder the opponent's strategy. The deck also aims to leverage aggressive creatures like Pyrogoyf and Broadside Bombardiers to apply pressure and close out the game quickly. Additionally, the inclusion of powerful removal spells like Fury and Sundering Eruption allows the deck to deal with threats efficiently. This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while presenting a strong and proactive offense.

The main idea of this deck is to utilize Mystic Forge and various artifact cards to assemble powerful combos and generate huge amounts of mana to cast game-winning spells like The One Ring. Cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Urza's Workshop help to tutor for key pieces and disrupt opponent's strategies. The deck focuses on ramping up quickly and overwhelming opponents with a combination of powerful artifacts and efficient mana generation. Mystic Forge acts as the centerpiece of the deck, allowing for consistent card advantage and powerful plays.

The deck focuses on controlling the game with counterspells, removal, and board wipes while stabilizing with powerful planeswalkers like Tamiyo. It also seeks to disrupt the opponent's mana base with cards like Back to Basics and Magus of the Moon. The deck can switch between offensive and defensive strategies thanks to cards like Snapcaster Mage and Dress Down. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and out-value them in the late game to secure victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing Mystic Forge in combination with various mana ramp and artifact cards to quickly assemble powerful combos and generate a significant advantage over opponents. By utilizing cards like Urza's Saga and Urza's Workshop to generate mana, along with Tezzeret, Cruel Captain and Karn, the Great Creator to search for key pieces, the deck aims to create explosive turns and overwhelm opponents with powerful artifacts and abilities. The use of cards like Voltaic Key and Manifold Key further support the combo strategy, while cards like Tormod's Crypt and Pithing Needle provide disruption against opposing strategies.

The deck focuses on quickly assembling a combination of cards that allows the player to win the game in one explosive turn. By using cards like Dark Ritual, Lotus Petal, and Simian Spirit Guide to generate mana, the deck aims to cast spells like Balustrade Spy and Undercity Informer to quickly mill the opponent's library. This enables cards like Narcomoeba and Thassa's Oracle to be put into play, winning the game instantly. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Duress and Cabal Therapy to protect the combo and ensure a successful victory.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Archon of Cruelty, using cards like Entomb and Brainstorm to set up the perfect reanimation targets. It also includes disruptive elements like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to protect the combo, as well as Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to help dig for key pieces. By efficiently reanimating threats and disrupting the opponent's game plan, the deck aims to overwhelm and control the game.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly put powerful Eldrazi creatures onto the battlefield using mana acceleration from cards like Ancient Tomb and Lotus Petal. Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer disrupt the opponent's game plan while Eldrazi Linebreaker and Glaring Fleshraker apply pressure. The deck also utilizes special lands like Eye of Ugin and Cavern of Souls to support the Eldrazi theme. Additionally, cards like Wasteland and Kozilek's Command provide disruption and removal options to control the game. This deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast and aggressive Eldrazi strategy.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Thoughtseize, then using Reanimate and Animate Dead to bring them back onto the battlefield. It also has disruption tools like Force of Will and Daze to protect its combo pieces. The deck leverages powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Archon of Cruelty to quickly close out the game, while utilizing cards like Cling to Dust and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student for card advantage and control. The deck also includes some tempo plays with cards like Brazen Borrower and Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's game plan.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures and then bringing them back into play for a devastating impact on the opponent. By utilizing cards like Entomb, Reanimate, and Animate Dead, the deck aims to put creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier into play ahead of schedule. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Thoughtseize to control the game while setting up its combo. The strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and control spells before they have a chance to react effectively.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and aggressively empty your library into your graveyard in order to win the game by utilizing combo pieces such as Balustrade Spy and Undercity Informer to put Thassa's Oracle onto the battlefield and win the game on the spot. The deck includes cards like Lotus Petal and Simian Spirit Guide to quickly generate mana, along with disruption and protection in the form of Thoughtseize, Pact of Negation, and Cabal Therapy. The deck aims to quickly assemble the necessary pieces to win the game before the opponent has a chance to react.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures, then bringing them back into play with cards like Reanimate and Animate Dead. It also includes disruptive elements like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to control the opponent's strategy. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with big threats like Archon of Cruelty and Murktide Regent while also having access to disruptive spells like Brainstorm and Daze. The combination of graveyard manipulation, reanimation spells, and control elements makes this deck a powerful and consistent combo reanimator archetype in Legacy 1 vs 1 format.

The main concept of this deck is centered around utilizing lands and control elements to disrupt the opponent's strategy while building up powerful land combos, such as Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage, to win the game. The deck includes various land cards like Bojuka Bog, Wasteland, and The Tabernacle at Pendrell Vale, along with control spells like Crop Rotation and Boseiju, Who Endures. By efficiently managing resources and leveraging the synergy between lands and spells, this deck aims to outmaneuver opponents and secure victory through powerful land-based win conditions.

The core concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Delver of Secrets, while disrupting their game plan with counterspells like Force of Will and Daze. By utilizing powerful spells like Lightning Bolt and Unholy Heat, this deck aims to control the board and pressure the opponent's life total quickly. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive strategy with fetch lands like Scalding Tarn and Volcanic Island providing flexibility and consistency. Overall, this UR Aggro deck is all about tempo, disruption, and aggression.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures and then bringing them back into play at a reduced cost. It uses cards like Entomb and Reanimate to put creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Murktide Regent into the graveyard, while also utilizing counterspells like Force of Will and Daze to protect the combo. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage and filtering, while cards like Brazen Borrower can provide tempo plays. The goal is to efficiently reanimate big threats and overwhelm the opponent before they can respond.
